name: who
longDescription: Print information about users who are currently logged in.

options.name: w
options.description: After each login name print a character indicating the user’s message status:

options.name: boot
options.description: Print the date and time of last system boot.

options.name: count
options.description: Print only the login names and the number of users logged on. Overrides all other options.

options.name: dead
options.description: Print information corresponding to dead processes.

options.name: heading
options.description: Print a line of column headings.

options.name: ips
options.description: Print ips instead of hostnames. with --lookup, canonicalizes based on stored IP, if available, rather than stored hostname.

options.name: login
options.description: List only the entries that correspond to processes via which the system is waiting for a user to login.  The user name is always ‘LOGIN’.

options.name: lookup
options.description: Attempt to canonicalize hostnames found in utmp through a DNS lookup.  This is not the default because it can cause significant delays on systems with automatic dial-up internet access.

options.name: message
options.description: After each login name print a character indicating the user’s message status:

options.name: mesg
options.description: After each login name print a character indicating the user’s message status:

options.name: process
options.description: List active processes spawned by init.

options.name: runlevel
options.description: Print the current (and maybe previous) run-level of the init process.

options.name: short
options.description: Print only name, line, and time (default).

options.name: writable
options.description: After each login name print a character indicating the user’s message status:
